Reviews.Title: “Fine if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: unspecified
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were very comfortable, quiet and well-appointed (including irons). Bathroom very good too, and very clean. A good view from a high-rise window was pleasant too. In the nearby area there are plenty of interesting restaurants and bars. The big down-side to this hotel is it is a moderate distance (up a hill) to the nearest Subway station, on 3rd Avenue. Some attractions are within walking distance, such as the art museums around Central Park, but there aren't many other things so you'll really need to use the Subway. Unless, of course, you need to be in the Upper East Side, in which case this location is great. You don't really need all the features of this hotel given you're in NYC, so whilst it is comfortable and generally fine, you really need to find a good rate to justify staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you're looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Rhapsodyinblue
Reviews.Content: Really off the beaten path. I needed a room fairly quickly, and needed to be uptown. This hotel was reasonable for Marriott in Manhattan (i.e.< $400). It is very miuch in a residential neighborhood, but there are places to eat nearby. It is VERY far on the East Side, and no easy way to get to anything touristy. The staff was very friendly, and the room was adequate. Small, but comfortable, with very comfortable bed. Very quiet. There is also a small bar/restaurant in the lobby which was suprisingly good. In summary, it is an average hotel. Stay here if the price is right, if the location works for you, or if you need to be on the East Side.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great....”
Reviews.Author: DrOfWaves
Reviews.Content: Run down, hot tub broken, pool freezing, overpriced. The neighborhood is a bit out of the way and across the street from project housing. We were a one night stay and quick to leave.

Reviews.Title: “great if you want to be on the UES”
Reviews.Author: fuzzyhb
Reviews.Content: This isn't really a tourist hotel, because you are quite a long way from the sites. the area is fine, you're close to Central Park and the East River and plenty of restaurants (recommend SalaThai on 89th/2nd). Small, basic room. good bed. good pillows. toiletries, air con, coffee making in-room, TV. good shower. blackout curtains. everything clean. no hassle check in. cafe within hotel is Cafe 92. very nice breakfast. two reasons why i haven't rated it excellent: 1) VERY expensive (as is all of manhattan) and 2) far out of town. dogs are not allowed but good pet hotel nearby

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Krason4
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. The employees steal from your rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with all aspects - the reviews helped”
Reviews.Author: FLBIZTRVL
Reviews.Content: Traveled here on business last week. Staff was great, location was convenient for LGA, Bronx, and of course UES. Don't stay here if you want to see all of the sites at midtown, etc, unless you are ok with a bit of travel. I like being in the 'neighborhoods' and all that comes with that so this was really good. Very convenient to lots of restaurants, groceries, etc. Great pizza joints nearby. Surprise was the gym - it is bigger than most basic ones. Be careful with the neighborhood across the street late at night, but I wouldn't avoid this place because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Pete S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for business a couple of times. The rooms are clean and spacious. The service overall is great. Valet is quick and the front desk is always willing to help. It's easy to valet or self park as well. The gym has enough to get a good workout in and they even have a sauna and steam room! Smaller but nice lobby. I really enjoy staying here and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Soccer tournament team hotel”
Reviews.Author: thewoods25
Reviews.Content: Hotel is the perfect location if you have a soccer tournament on Randalls Island. Hotel is clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Guest laundry facilities were convenient which is a must for traveling soccer teams; wash and dry $2 each. Due to our tight schedule I missed the coffee bar altogther. Some of the kids used the pool and I heard no complaints. Taxi ride to Time Square ranged between $11 and $15. Stay away from private sedans use only marked taxicabs. With all the teams in the hotel I heard no hallway noise or perhaps I was dead tired. Ignore the comments by a reviewer concerning the projects across the street, most times you saw people going about their daily lives and families. At no time did I feel threatened or concerned for my safety. Only down side is that the teams had no where to hang out in the hotel and the rooms were just too small for that.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was excellent for this level of hotel, area was scary.”
Reviews.Author: j g
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting that ran terribly over and found myself stuck in the city for the night with no reservations made for a hotel, and a little at my wits end. I quickly asked my assistant to just book me a room, any room, as I did not want to be left sleeping in a terminal somewhere waiting to catch the next means of transportation out of the city When she got online she saw that it was a "name brand hotel, with a pool and that it was on the Upper East side" and quickly booked it for me. She does not know the city well and did not understand how far up it was. When I saw the address I cringed, but thought, maybe it won't be too bad, after all, it's a Marriott. When I arrived at the location I was immediately very concerned, as it is directly across from the projects. I jumped out of my cab, with a slight worry on how I would catch a cab in the morning but proceeded in. Once into the hotel, I felt safe. The staff were very good considering the star level and location of the hotel. Informative and helpful. The wait staff in the restaurant were delightful and prompt on making sure I was taken care of nicely. The rooms were exceptionally large for the city, the housekeeping staff was quick in bringing me extra towels and the room was clean. My only real complaints about the hotel is that it is a bit tired, and the location is on the border of Harlem and directly across from the projects. If you are elderly or traveling with young children, this is something to keep in mind. But considering that the staff was incredibly helpful, even pointing me in the direction of where I could go buy a swim suit, and the premises were large, in the event that I was ever stranded in the city again, my only hesitation to stay would be the location other wise I would stay again Oh, and their wifi is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep quality POOR”
Reviews.Author: djjbtoronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the night of Feb 16 2012. It was booked through my work. The room was clean and relatively modern. Check in and check out were easy. The main problem I had was that I was initially unable to sleep due to the snoring of someone in the room next door. It was incredible how the sound transferred into my room. The only solution was to turn the fan on the ac vent (without changing the temp) to drown out the noise. Two colleagues of mine had similar problems with thin walls/poor sound insulation. When travelling on business sleep is a priority and I would not stay here again due to this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Emily M
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of this hotel this morning. I stayed for two nights (Wednesday & Thursday) on business. The hotel room itself was alright---the bed was comfortable, the view was ok, and it was clean. However, it was clear that it was a little run down. Plus, the Jacuzzi is broken and the pool is FREEZING. My main issue with the hotel was the service.I called prior to booking the hotel to verify that I could send a large fax and make copies of a large document. They said no problem, so I booked the hotel. I arrived Wednesday night and let the front desk know that I needed to fax some items, and they did so happily. I was impressed. I then asked about Fed-Ex service. I clearly stated several times that the documents I was sending needed to arrive at my hotel in the morning. I asked if I should go to a Fed Ex store, but the front desk staff said no, they would send it. I filled out the mailing information and left the package at the front desk. They said pickup would be at 7pm. I then grabbed dinner and picked up my receipt from the shipment at about 8pm. The front desk staff didn't say a word when I picked up my receipt from the desk. The next morning, my office hadn't received the package, so I called Fed Ex around 1pm. They had no record of the package. I was out on business at that time, so I called the front desk. The woman told me that the package had not been picked up. She blamed it on Fed Ex for not arriving. I get that they have no control over Fed Ex. These things happen. But honestly, I should have received a phone call from the front desk staff to let me know that this had happened. I looked like an idiot in front of my office---they were expecting the package. I told this to the front desk staff, and they were extremely hostile towards me for the rest of my stay. The ice was dripping when I asked them to make the copies that I had requested in advance. I wouldn't stay here again. I don't recommend it for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Koter
Reviews.Content: I just left the Marriott in NY, it was second visit to the Hotel. I stay on the Upper East Side because of the location, it is close to my friends and family. If you want to be close to Times Square or Soho then you will have to take a cab quite a few blocks. But if you are like me and needed to be on the UpperEast Side then this hotel is a great location. They offer a great gym a lap pool, steam and hot tub. The rooms are small but you are in NY so that is too be expected. They are a nice with a flat screen TV and good size bed. The hotel staff are all very friendly and I would return for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is fantastik, rooms are clean and adequate. Restaurant attached (not owned) by hotel is only fair but there are plenty of restaurants in the area. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good service, and cheap parking”
Reviews.Author: Jack37
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting someone nearby, this is the place to stay. Uniformly friendly and helpful staff, and comfortable rooms of good quality. This is a popular hotel with both a domestic and international clientele. Right next to FDR Drive entrance. Great parking deal at $20/night for self-park at reliable garage just down the block. Skip the restaurants. For breakfast, go around the corner to the Eastside Eatery (1st and 91st) and for lunch and dinner, any of the hundreds of interesting places in the neighborhood. Come to this hotel once and you'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant area, unprofessional staff, but free wifi!”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandar M
Reviews.Content: For a day trip I generally would not care about my stay since I am not in the room but from the start i did not have a pleasant experience. The location is not ideal= BAD neighborhood, not THAT close to the subway and the subway only has TWO lines. On to the room: Scratched and dirty lamps, DIRTY mattress Bathroom: DIRTY toilet. and no bathroom air ventilation? LASTLY FRONT DESK: not helpful, not hospitable, no agent was professionally responsive except for the asian guy in the morning checkout

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a Great Stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: angelacaminiti
Reviews.Content: We had a AWESOME time wish we could of stayed longer. The hotel is CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN and the SERVICE from the ENTIRE STAFF WAS EXCEPTIONAL. A Special thanks to the Housekeeping Team for their dedication in providing a CLEAN HOTEL. Jose went over and beyond so we didn't have to switch hotels. Joe was also very friendly and courteous and the Bellman were also great. The location is away from the hussle and just the way we like it. We felt secure at all times and would defintely visit this hotel again. This hotel represents the true SPIRIT TO SERVE. With Sincere Gratitude Angela, Valarie, and Sara

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, good staff, nice room”
Reviews.Author: NuAndAeM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a week on holiday trip. The room was very clean, pretty big size for being NY, and the beds very comfortable. the bathroom, with tube, was very clean as well. We asked to changed room after the first night, at our neighboors were extremely noisy, and sharing a connecting door with their room, the insolation was very poor. The staff was very friendly and found us another room at once. The breakfast is quite ok, but pretty expensive for what it is. I would rather recommend to walk a few blocks to get enormous, good and very cheap bagels. There is free wifi, the staff as always been pleasant and helpful, and the hotel and location are very quiet. The only negative point is that it's a 15 minutes walk away from the nearest tube, but that didn't bother us too much. We used to walk to the station in the mornings, and come back by cab. When it was time to leave, they ordered private transportation that was a bit cheaper than a cab (and much more comfortable ;) ) We will definitely come back to this hotel for our next trip

Reviews.Title: “Our NYC stay near Centeral Park”
Reviews.Author: ldyangler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Courtyard Upper East Side could not have been any nicer !! Not the most modern but very delightful, Exstremely friendly and helpful staff. We had 2 Queen beds which were wonderfuly comfortable and our room and bath Sparkling Clean, especially the Tub !! This hotel is in a quiet upscale neighborhood and easy access by taxi to Central Park and Mid Town. We would deffinatly stay here again in this very good and safe location away from the hustle and bustle of the busy areas of the city !!! Taxi however was a must, not really walkable to the main areas of the city...

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: islandfix
Reviews.Content: I typically visit New York several times a year and usually stay in midtown or Times Square. I tried this hotel because some friends were going to be there for an auction at Sotheby's. The first thing I noticed was how much quieter it was than other hotels I have stayed at. The rooms were decent size (for New York) and very clean. Check in was easy and the staff was very courteous and helpful. The rates were still high considering it wasn't close to tourist attractions. Personally I didn't mind the location because it was only a few short blocks to the subway and I know my way around the City. I would stay here again just to get a better night's sleep than I do in mid town or Times Square, where the noise from the traffic, cabs, sirens, and people tend to keep me up all night.

Reviews.Title: “Inoffensive and relatively affordable, but unexceptional”
Reviews.Author: TomandLor
Reviews.Content: The emphasis is on "East: in Upper East Side, as it is East of most attractions in a mid-range residential nabe. It is amidst many tower blocks, and across from public housing, which is not as scary as it may sound. The locals there were quiet and the ares is safe, if bland. But a ten minute walk puts one in the heart of the UES, and overall the Courtyard served us well when we had a late MGMT concert at the Guggenheim (toooo cool). The rooms were small but stylish, the lobby small and conservative in decor and the price, for NYC was as low as one could expect withoug sactificing quality ($300/night). Not to be avoided by any means, but try another spot if it is your honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel close to Mount Sinai”
Reviews.Author: MCNICE9
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as I was having a meeting at Mount Sinai. The hotel is really close to the School/Hospital if you do not mind the hills. The hoteal staff is really friendly. Parking is close - they offer a discount if you stay in the hotel. Room was really small, but clean. Bathroom was really clean. There are several budget restaurants close by and also several Starbucks for you daily cafeine. The lobby is very bright - you can have friends over to hand out. I did not try the fitness center or the pool so can not comment on those. Subway is a few blocks away. Very quiet location too. Overall, nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC Location”
Reviews.Author: TRGLASS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for five nights on business and the customer service was great. The rooms were a little small, however it fit my business needs perfectly. The staff was great, the rooms CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN and the fitness center was wonderful. The subway station is about four city blocks away and taxis are plentiful. There is a small cafe style restaurant attached to the hotel that was reasonably priced and provided good food. Additionally, there are additional restaurants in the surrounding area for your dining pleasure. I will definitely consider staying at this hotel upon my next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and even found on street parking.”
Reviews.Author: Sallad13
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip to NYC over thanksgiving weekend. Friendly staff, large room, quiet and clean. It's a do over.

Reviews.Title: “first time to nyc”
Reviews.Author: auld33
Reviews.Content: Great location...quiet but still felt very in the midst of things...walked to Central Park with coffee in the morning, walked to a bbq joint and got some beers at night. Hotel was very clean. Shower was great and beds were comfy. I would def stay here when coming back to NYC. nice to be able to hail a taxi and get to the excitement within minutes but come back to a quieter, cozy hotel. stayed two nights.

Reviews.Title: “unhappy customer”
Reviews.Author: annflynn9
Reviews.Content: I had a very bad experiance when staying at this hotel, they charged another person room on my credit card without my permission and have refused to refund the money as I live in Ireland it difficult to fight my case, so myself and my friends will be avoiding this hotel like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a nice Manhattan neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lfb1121
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights, good location at a good price. Our room was very comfortable and quiet something to appreciate in the city, and even a local view and light.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: VacationerHouston
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice when visiting relatives nearby, most recently Nov 6-8, 2011, and definitely recommend it. The rooms are spotless, clean bathrooms, nice linens, quiet, and convenient to the bus lines on 92nd and York that will take you to 57th and turn on 57th towards 5th Ave. etc. I like this hotel except that the only ice machine is off the lobby and there is no refrigerator in the room for personal drinks or food items. There is a mini bar at a price. I have not eaten at the hotel's restaurant so cannot speak to that. A definite plus is the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melissa M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during one of the summer heat waves and our air conditioner broke. Our family normally stays here when they're in town, so it was nice to actually check it out for ourselves. Rooms are comfortable and have nice views of the city. Staff is friendly. Our room came with free breakfast, which was ok, however if you're not in a rush, you're in NY, and there's plenty of nice breakfast places within walking distance from the hotel. The location is a little far from everything, especially subways, but if you're willing to travel, you can oftentimes get a good rate at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic stay, Great staff, terrible WiFi”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night for a business trip. The staff was extremely friendly. The room was your typical smallish NYC hotel room but was clean and well apportioned. There is an indoor lap pool, hot tub, and workout facility with machines and free weights. There is a very small diner next door that serves breakfast & lunch (very small menu). And of course, there are dozens of dining options within a short walk. My biggest complaint was wireless - it was absolutely useless. The mattress wasn't real comfortable either.

Reviews.Title: “amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: rita06
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights & wondered why we had not stayed there every time we went to NYC. Heard about it from friends & we thanked them profusely. Room is comfortable, bathroom much bigger & nicer than at the hotel we usually stay at which is more expensive, but not as comfortable. Every staff member was incredibly nice, helpful, fun & interesting to talk to. They went out of their way to make sure we knew the bus routes, the neighborhood restaurants & markets. We like a neighborhood & the upper east side is a lovely area with trees, riverside walks & a bus stop on the corner. Again, best of all, the great atmosphere because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service I've every had at any hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: NJDusty
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while participating in a cancer walk. The room was clean, bathrooms bright and updated, and it was incredibly quiet (especially for NYC). The STANDOUT here was the customer service. It exceeded our expecations at every level. We had left our car sitting by the front door while we were checking in. The doorman came in to us to let us know that a parking spot on the street opened up, and we could park there til Monday morning for free. He even stood at the spot until we could move the car. While checking in, we requested extra towels. By the time we got to the elevator, housekeeping was there, on the elevator with us, headed to our room with our extra towels. Our first night, our room was VERY warm. The following morning we mentioned it to the front desk, and by the time we returned from our day out, the thermostat had been fixed and the room was perfect. We had a slight security concern and called the front desk to inform them. There was a security officer at our door within minutes (although we never asked for this, we only called to let them know of a situation in the hotel) and he was very thorough in obtaining the information he needed to do what he needed to do. Finally, both nights of our stay we asked for recommendations for a restaurant/takeout/and wine delivery, and the front desk took care of everything for us. We could not have been happier with our stay here and I would recommend it to anyone travelling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “23 straight days here for business & it almost felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Kelli H
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling for 8 yrs for my job and 23 days is the longest I've ever been out at one time but the Courtyard Marriott Manhattan/Upper East Side made my "home away from home" so inviting it was difficult to leave. Everyone from the doormen to the cleaning crew made an effort to make my stay as comfortable as possible and spending as much time on the road as I do makes this kind of atmosphere a goldmine! I have read a couple of reviews regarding the distance of the subway from the hotel being a little far but theres actually one at 96th (and Lex I think) thats only a few blocks away and is a nice quick walk. A special thanks to my housekeeping lady, Carmina, and the doorman, Matt McNeil, for going above & beyond to make my stay here memorable! The Marriott Corporation would be wise to use these two employees as their "gold standard" of customer service in the travel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Just Terrible”
Reviews.Author: TTSN
Reviews.Content: I actually was at a conference at this hotel today. The parking situation was awful!! Valet parking cost $45 and I was told as I tried to leave that it would take 45 minutes for them to get my car. This was told to me rudely by a front desk employee. I then spoke to the bellman who sent me to walk to the "garage" at a location in which there was in fact no garage. I ultimately waited. My friend self parked for a $25 price. She ended up with her seat wedged into the dashboard and unmovable. The garage had moved her car and then denied leaving the car in this situation. It took more than an hour to get it out. The conference room was not great. It had no white board or bulletin board for brain storming. It was dreary and cold. Just awful!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Port in the Storm”
Reviews.Author: leslie06
Reviews.Content: The best way I can describe our wonderful experience is to include the contents of a letter I wrote to Bill Marriott, CEO: Dear Mr. Marriott: The purpose of this letter is to sing the praises of your staff at the Courtyard by Marriott on East 92nd Street in New York. When our plans for “Hurricane Irene” weekend changed at the last minute, we found our wonderful port in the storm at this hotel. Not only did we get a lovely room, exactly the size and type we needed, we were also told that normal checkout notices were waived; whenever we got a flight out of town, we were free to check out with no penalties or extra night charges. As we now know, Manhattan was spared the worst of the storm, but prior to that, your staff remained cool, calm, and collected. On Sunday, August 28, when the subways and buses were shut down, we received a notice stating that normal housekeeping would not be available. But I have to say, nothing seemed to skip a beat. We were provided plenty of clean towels and all amenities we needed. The front desk staff members were all courteous and responsive; they even stored my milk in the employee refrigerator and brought it out for me each morning. The restaurant on Saturday night, while slammed with people, kept churning out food and smiles. I know this is exactly the kind of service your brand stands for, and I want you to know that the Upper East Side Courtyard by Marriott did you proud!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: marebu16
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a Saturday night prior to a Yankee Game. Good location easy walk from Grand Central Station and to Central Park. Close location to subway. Good Bagel Shop - eso bagel on the block, Duane Reed in building for snacks. Did not use restaurant. Concierge sold us a metro card to get to Statue of Liberty and back for my husband and myself but on the way back after he went through turnstyle I found there was not enough left on the card for me to get through so that was annoying and dishonest. Bellhop service was helpful we checked bags before and after check in. Room was very large and three large windows. We had a KING with sofabed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, BAD location”
Reviews.Author: vonschwind
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip-- this was the designated conference hotel with a special rate. Otherwise I would not have chosen somewhere so far from the subway, so far from EVERYTHING. Even though my conference was on the Upper East Side (at various locations), this place was always a hike, uphill to get back to town. It rained all weekend, making the extra distance even more of a pain. I suppose that's why the prices are lower. Other than the location, most everything about the hotel was great. Room was large, clean, very comfortable. Staff was courteous enough, but always very busy at the front desk-- I had to wait several times because things were slow, or maybe other customers were needy. I used the exercise room, which was clean and helpful. There is an indoor pool, but I didn't use it. No vending machines!!! It seems many Marriott locations now make you buy your (over-priced) snacks from the front desk. That's annoying-- I stocked up on snacks at the convenience mart around the corner, once I discovered this problem. Decent view across the city-- because you're so far from civilization, there are fewer buildings to block the view. Oh, I remember the elevators being slow, tiny, and always crowded-- always people with luggage and strollers, always cleaning staff with carts. I started using the stairs, rather than waiting. Overall, I was pleased with the room, but in the future, I'd happily pay $20-$50 more for somewhere in Midtown. You'll recover the extra in what you save on cab fares and in the time you save by walking less distance.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugMissy
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. It is off the beaten path, and is in a more car friendly area. It has the pool and the internet that we needed. However, be aware that it is quite a number of blocks away from the nearest subway. I liked that there were sufficiently good places to eat in the area. The nice rate offsets not being in a central Manhattan location.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: s0ccerfamily6
Reviews.Content: SO glad we found this place! Reasonable rate for Manhatten. Only stayed here one night but wish we had stayed more. Had a room with a King bed. Entire hotel is clean and luxurious. Room was very comfortable. Walking distance to Guggenheim, Met, and Natural History Museums. Easy access to bus and walking distance to subway. Location is very upper east Manhatten so it is on the far end of the downtown NYC action but with the transit systems in NYC it makes for a nice getaway location at the end of the day. Parking fee is also reasonable $20 for a 24-hour period.

Reviews.Title: “Better value hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: exda85
Reviews.Content: Price is high but cheaper than comparable hotels in Manhattan. Good value and good location. 92nd and 1st avenue is the upper east side, great for museums and good for shopping, around the corner is the Vinegar Factory a gourmet shop owned by Eli Zabar. get whitefish salad and shmear it on their breads. the hotel staff tries hard. the elevators are slow and the pool only open a couple of hours in the morning and afternoon. crosstown taxis are inexpensive and convenient. overall pleasing and worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Manhattan stay”
Reviews.Author: skymeadow
Reviews.Content: I was delighted to find this Manhattan hotel. Super-friendly desk staff. Clean, newly decorated rooms. Big comfortable bed with lots of pillows. Quiet, well-airconditioned, plenty of hot water in the shower. It even had a river view. AND it was a bargain. The neighborhood is great, in a quiet nook of Manhattan I'd never explored before. There's an interesting small food store on the corner. Go to the Vinegar Factory market for take-out breakfast, and eat it on the grounds of Gracie Mansion, dog-watching by the East River. The Onassis reservoir at Central park is a short walk away, worth a visit. I'd stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Marriott Staff!”
Reviews.Author: allvonrs
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had just completed an across the US road trip and arriving at the Marriott was like hitting an oasis in a desert! The facilities and services were impeccable but there are not words to describe the kindness of the staff. Shannon on the Main Desk went way beyond the call of duty and Matt of the Bell Staff was so helpful and delightful that it was a joy interacting with them!! The housecleaning staff was friendly and nurturing. I want to go back and live there. No I can't afford it, but the rate I paid was quite reasonable for NYC. Looking forward to our next stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dependable, clean & convenient for visit to Upper East Side”
Reviews.Author: dcbird
Reviews.Content: We have family on the Upper East Side and have stayed in a variety of hotels when visiting, but the Courtyard by Marriott has been the most consistently good, in terms of price for what you get: a clean, quiet, well laid out room (though even the suites are a bit on the small side), good heating & cooling system, good water pressure, friendly responsive staff. (All of the above qualities are things that have been problematic in other East Side hotels -- some of them very overpriced.) Depending on time of your stay, you may get a good rate, though my main complaint is that to get a corner room, which is bigger and more comfortable, you have to pay extra. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be on the Upper East Side.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home base in NYC for families”
Reviews.Author: PDDNOSMom
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Our room was very spacious and quiet. We had room 914, which is right next to the elevators, but we did not hear ANY noise from this at all. The bathrooms are large for NYC and the air conditioning was quiet. The beds were very comfortable! The free coffee, laundry facilities, gym, and pool are all located on the lower level. This hotel is located in residential upper East side, and is within walking distance of many reasonable places to eat. There is a hotel restaurant, but with so many options nearly we didn't use it. Our only complaint is that the hours that you can use the pool are VERY limited, which was disappointing, especially now that the weather is getting quite warm. They really should revisit this, because one of the main reasons we booked this hotel was that they have an indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location, and not close to MSKCC”
Reviews.Author: LuvinMy369Hero
Reviews.Content: I really don't know why Sloan-Kettering says this hotel is near the hospital, because it really isn't. The hospital is basically 30 blocks away. I later found out there was a bus right by the hotel that stops at the hospital, but not being from the city, I had no idea (plus I had never taken a bus before in my life). My husband had surgery for cancer in Nov.2010. People from his work pulled money together so I could stay here, the price was astronomical in my eyes. over $200 per night and that was with a government discount! I told the front desk at checkin my husband was having surgery and I would be alone. I was frightened in NY and scared to death, they really didn't do anything to make my visit more comfortable. The only thing they did do was refund the money for days that my husband work had prepaid that I did not stay, and provided me with a map of NY. This place is across the street from a high rise project. I did not feel safe at night as a woman traveling alone. The rooms were nice, and beds comfy. It was just ok really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, near awesome restaurants and Central Park”
Reviews.Author: RunningGuru
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned prior to my trip, because I always end up at a noisy hotel prior to a big race. I am originally from the NYC area and knew this would be a great location--near Central Park and the start of the NYC Half Marathon. The room did not disappoint. It was clean and comfortable, quiet, and the housekeeping staff on the floor was excellent and friendly. I had difficulty with my cable TV, but after calling the front desk a member of the engineering staff was up in my room within minutes and had the problem fixed promptly. Only complaint was that the plastic under the fabric shade of the lamp next to the bed was cracked giving a funkadelic lighting when it was turned on. The hotel never addressed this. But, not a major issue. I highly recommend selecting a high level corner room--I had views of the East River and bridge. Overall, a great value for the location, comfort, and views.

Reviews.Title: “Servicable, pricet”
Reviews.Author: Jeff94114
Reviews.Content: Went for 1 theater/museum weekend with S.O. The hotel is just average, rooms are clean, decent, well furnished. Neighborhood is good, upper east side, short walk from Metropolitan and Guggenheim, lots of fun restaurants. Staff are extremely helpful and put a lot of effort into their service. Lobby is small, with no bathrooms on that level. I would certainly return here just for the convenience...not expecting a fine hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but but not near anything”
Reviews.Author: dreimer043
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night before running the NYC half marathon. I had a discounted rate of 189.00 through NYRR. The hotel itself is on the small side, with a bar and restaurant that closed at 10 pm on a saturday night. The pool was only open until 6 pm! The hotel isnt near anything within walking distance. It was in a safe, residential area and clean.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly acceptable hotel in a residential area”
Reviews.Author: lafcomike
Reviews.Content: The upper east side of Manhattan is not the hub of NYC nightlife. It is a residential neighborhood lined with lots of local ethnic restaurants and shops selling the necessities of daily life. So if one doesn't mind being in this section of town, the hotel is a perfectly reasonable, moderately priced option. The common areas were clean if a bit dated looking. The two elevators could be quite slow during peak times and I found myself walking down several flights of stairs after the wait lasted a few minutes. I liked the room which was large by NYC standards and the bed was really comfortable. Is this a destination hotel? Of course not. But it is clean, well run and perfectly functional as a base for exploring the City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but beware of recent subway construction on 2nd Avenue”
Reviews.Author: Ciph
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed again at this Marriott, have been back several times. Nice hotel, especially for the price. Decent area, clean rooms, basic lobby and services, small but serviceable gym and pool area. You're away from the hustle and bustle, but this Marriott is quiet, safe, feels like you're in a corner of "real" New York, not the tourist-trap horror that is Times Square. If you want decent food, you are going to have to order takeout or walk to a restaurant, and some of them may be a fifteen minute hike. Hence there are far more luxurious New York hotels, but at much higher prices. Other reviewers accurately describe the hotel and experience. Be warned, however, there is a lot of construction going on near Second Avenue. There was snow on the ground this trip, and when you have snow plus construction, it was a traffic nightmare getting to the hotel. Also, if you have to walk on or around Second Avenue, you're going to have to use pedestrian pathways, because there is a lot of construction zones and equipment. You cannot, I repeat cannot, hear any construction from the hotel, it is quiet as always. But getting in and out can be a pain. As a business traveller, I'm going to have to rethink whether I will stay here until the construction is complete, because construction and monstrous traffic waste time and add stress if you have deadlines, as most business travelers do. If you are staying here for leisure, I don't see the construction as an impediment, and in fact it may be interesting to look at all that is going on with this major subway project. You can read about the Second Avenue subway construction here: http://www.mta.info/capconstr/sas/.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a residential neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: cx20009
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminds me of a standard suburban Courtyard; that being said, with so many choices of hotels in New York City, I can find no compelling reason to stay here instead of in more of a busy, touristy area, with more amenities for travellers. As many others have stated, this hotel is located in a residential area (2nd Ave and E 92nd Street) and the nearest subway stop is 10 blocks away. That in itself usually doesn't bother me-- I am used to walking this many blocks. However, there's nothing special to make the walk more enjoyable. On the flip side, I had no feelings of feeling unsafe when leaving the subway walking to the hotel. The rooms, in general are fine. Nothing really to write home about. In the room I was in, the heater was continually on at full blast. There was no 'off' switch and chaning the temperature didn't help at all, either. We ended up keeping the window open all night to balance the blasting furance. The others in the group had no issues with their rooms, except for the minor point that they couldn't find the blankets in the room. As I did not use the internet, parking, pool or any other facilities, I cannot comment on them. The bottom line: if you are in the neighborhood visiting folks, this is a good hotel. Otherwise, for all that NYC has to offer, it is too far away from the fun that NYC is known for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: bostonluke
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night over the Christmas holiday. It is a nice, modern hotel. The rooms are more along the lines of what you would expect for a layout (instead of the crazy designs of some NYC hotels that have been converted from other purposes. Check-in an check-out were a breeze. Shower and TV worked and the room was quiet. That's really all I was looking for in the hotel. One note, this hotel is really not near much of anything, including the subway if you have bags. Some public housing high-rise looking buildings are right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in the Upper East Side”
Reviews.Author: MumaRules
Reviews.Content: New York City in December is pretty expensive - so it is hard to judge the value of this particular hotel. We stayed in a king suite, which was nicely laid out. The bathroom was easily accessed from both the bedroom and living room. There was a microwave and small refrigerator in the living room, which was a plus. The minuses -- the king size bed was not comfortable (glad we were only staying one night) and the walls were thin (as in you could hear your neighbors on both sides). We were disappointed with the pool hours - closed at 9pm on Friday night and then didn't open until 10am on Saturday morning. Thus, we were not able to take advantage of this amenity. We were pleasantly surprised when the hotel parking valet suggested we park on the street at no cost rather than using the garage for $20. This is only available as a weekend option. Overall, the hotel worked for us for our one night stay but would probably look for another option on our next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place on the Upper East Side”
Reviews.Author: eaglestailg8ter
Reviews.Content: Valet parked - very efficient and friendly staff got us quickly off the street! Was offered a room upgrade to the 33rd floor for no additional cost! Close to Rockefeller Center, Grand Central, & 5th Ave shopping! The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff really caught my attention! Well run hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Ruth_Teddington
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend for 4 nights and selected hotel on basis that it was in a great location, appeared nice and clean and offered good value. If you are looking for a romantic hotel this isn't it. If you just want somewhere nice and clean to sleep, this is it. All the advantages: - 2 double beds made for a great stay as 2 friends sharing a room - nice, large, very clean rooms - great location for travelling around the city - friendlly, helpful concierge service - free internet/computer access - right next door was a 24h convenience store which was great for nibbles and morning fresh juices - also right next door was a mani/pedi bar - great for walking back in paper slippers! Disadvantages - VERY noisy outside, but HEY this is NYC. We got earplugs and they worked a treat. - only basic toileteries like soap...but then I always bring my own anyway. - didn't check out the rest of the hotel other than the room, lobby and business centre so can't comment on dining/breakfast/pool. One thing I'd recommend if you are staying in New York: do not bother with breakfast in the hotels as (despite being pricey) there are so many places to eat and it's part and parcel of staying in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: 6dogs
Reviews.Content: It is very hard to find a well-priced, clean, modern hotel in NYC these days. We were delighted (and relieved) when we stayed at the Courtyard on 92nd Street and 1st Avenue. The room was immaculate and the furnishings modern and upscale. The front desk staff were jolly and accommodating. Also, the hotel offers inexpensive ($20.00 for 24 hour) parking. The closest subway station, 96th and Lexington Avenue is about a five to seven minute walk. This will be our hotel of choice for the Upper East Side.

Reviews.Title: “UnfairlyTreated”
Reviews.Author: Trb123
Reviews.Content: I made a booking for the Marriott for Oct 6-8 and somehow there was an error with their system and the booking was made for Oct 1-3. I didn't find this out until Oct 4, 2 days before I was to leave to New York. The manager only agreed to refund half the price I paid (350USD). So I ended up paying 350 USD and getting nothing in return, and still have to book another hotel for those dates. All because of a system error. I feel that I was unfairly treated.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lizcoughlin1953
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Courtyard on Thursday, Sept 9, for one night. The minute we got out of the taxi, we were welcomed by friendly staff. Check-in went smoothly and the front desk gentleman, Joe, was friendly and super helpful. Our room, 1420, was quiet and away from the elevator. The attractive lobby looked new as the hotel is only five years old. There was a flat screen television in the lobby and two in the adjacent bar where we enjoyed a drink as we watched a sports event. The bartender was so friendly and brought us an appetizer free of charge - just because! Nice gesture. The hotel has a lap pool, hot tub, and fitness center. The location worked perfectly for us. Our business was in the upper east side, but we zipped down to Wall Street on the FDR in no time by taxi. Good pick for New York. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needed Very Cheap Room”
Reviews.Author: gahlisary
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, because I was forced out of my apartment. Hotel is in a very weird location, 92nd Street east of 1st Ave. Parking on the street is very difficult in this neighborhood: that stretech of 92nd street is totally roped off, and that same block of 91st is also impossible. Furthermore the streets nearby are all affected by the 2nd Ave subway construction. When we arrived late at night, the lobby was roped off because they were cleaning the carpets and the front desk agent wasn't particularly friendly. Bought a bottle of Fiji water from the little Market there in the lobby, small bottle $3, large bottle $6. Room Service pricing. Pathetic. Guestroom was very small, bed was fine, bathroom also small, but at least very clean and modern. It was unfortunte we needed to stay there, hope to never have to again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money.. Fair Location”
Reviews.Author: skymiler9
Reviews.Content: Was worried about the distance at first but got used to it in 1 day. Loved the staff and the services available in the nearby area including a ton of grocery, laundry facilities and restaurants. Cafe 92 exists, but star bucks is only 2 blocks away so really a lot of choices for breakfast, lunch and snacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adsmith284
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Very friendly staff. It was far away from most of the spots I was traveling too, but I imagine if you use the subway system, it wouldn't be a big problem. I just took a cab everywhere and was where I needed to be in 15-20 minutes. Room was very clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jule_Berlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights and have now found the hotel to return to when on business in New York. The rooms are spacious and very clean, there is free internet and the staff is very helpful, professional and friendly. The location is great, a few steps from the subway at Lexington and 53rd - which takes you everywhere in the city. I will definitely come back. And of course you can reach many of the major sights and shopping in walking distance - not a bad thing either....

Reviews.Title: “Practical choice, offering great value on the upper east side”
Reviews.Author: Fidelma10
Reviews.Content: The upper eats side is, perhaps, not an obvious choice for a long weekend trip in terms of location, but it worked out really well. It may be a 10 minute plus walk to the subway, but you pass an almost infinite variety of restaurants, which more than makes up for it. If you want to be spoilt for choice for dinner and breakfast, this area is superb. Unfair to single out just one, but do make sure you visit Eli's Vinegar Factory for great weekend breakfasts. Once on the subway you are within easy reach of most of Manhattan, so the less than central location isn't an issue. In fact, it was great to feel that we were in a real New York neighborhood rather than experience just tourist city. Service, rooms and facilities were just what you would expect from the Courtyard/Marriott family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - 1 mile from the Theater District”
Reviews.Author: HikerDave
Reviews.Content: Brought our adult daughter up on a Saturday to see "Wicked" on Broadway. Very pleased with the size and cleanliness of the room - 25th floor corner room. We used Marriott points as all NYC hotels were basically $300/night for that particular weekend. Located 1/2 mile from Rockefeller Center and 1 mile from Theater District - overall, not on top of the action, but fairly close to it. Found a great "hole the wall" deli called "Angelo's" on 6th Ave. directly across from Central Park. Purchased $3 - 2 egg/bacon bagel sandwiches (fresh scrambled eggs- a bargain anywhere) and went across the strfeet to eat them in the Park.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: WOW -- when I found this hotel, and its rate, on our corporate travel booking system I didn't believe it. How could one of the major hotel chains have a property in New York that was so reasonably priced? How could this place be so affordable when the independent properties in the area (many of which were pretty basic) were so expensive? What was wrong with this place? Needing a hotel on the Upper East Side, and relishing the rate, I booked the property. Upon arrival, I was pleased to see that nothing, in fact, is wrong with this place. It's a pretty standard Courtyard, with the amenities you'd expect. (In fact, the decor was a little elevated compared to the typical Courtyard.) My room was on the small-ish side (it's NY, after all), but not ridiculously so. It was clean, comfortable, and quiet. I wanted an Upper East Side property for business, so the hotel's location worked very well for me. I was pleased to see several restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel; some were fancy and others were take-out places. The neighborhood felt safe, even at night. There's also a grocery store very close to the hotel that was a great place to grab some water, etc. A reasonably priced gem in Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at great price”
Reviews.Author: GCSMaryland
Reviews.Content: Wanted a safe, clean, well located hotel near the port of N.Y. for 1 pre-cruise night. This hotel was perfect. Super clean and friendly. Priced below comperable hotels in mid town. Easy access from east to west to the port. Would definately stay again on return for any reason to N.Y. Beds were super comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service seems like it might be going out of business.”
Reviews.Author: jm36
Reviews.Content: The daytime staff behind the desk was excellent (big tall bald guy) all others really could not care. Management should take a course in customer service. I have stayed in this hotel multiply times, and it appears instead of fixing and/or replacing items in a room it's easier to make it disappear. Some rooms have a counter bathroom mirror, some rooms have a floor lamp, some rooms have an alarm clock that works. Lobby is not inviting. Cafe 92 is not part of the hotel, and the owner is more concerned with his catering business than any order from a hotel guest. My advise is to go midtown where the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem and worth the walking or taxi cabs to get around the city”
Reviews.Author: corresources
Reviews.Content: We live in CT and wanted to get out of town for Easter. We drove in and was pleasantly surprised when the valet guy told us we could save the $40 valet fee by parking on the street. He walked up, pointed it out and my husband followed in the car. Upon check-in, I asked to be upgraded; and was to room 1212. Although it was next to the elevator, it was relatively quiet. The room was clean, had a microwave and small fridge. The TV's looked a bit dated (not flat screen) the bath amenities were just shampoo & conditioner. BUT, this place had a swimming pool on the LL, a gym and complimentary coffee....which we took back to the room. Service was a bit slow-we had to call 2 times to get our bag. Speaking of slow, so is the 2 elevators. Great location for restaurants if you walk over 1 block. Also convenient to FDR. The ASPCA is a few doors down-we almost came home with another cat! I have stayed in many NYC hotels and for the price it was well worth it. If you are looking to be in the "middle" and "heart" of the city, this is not for you. And finally, our Mercedes was still there on the street the next morning!

Reviews.Title: “Modern & clean but poor service and not so convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jusbjen
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel multiple times despite the public transportation challenge (subway is 6+ blocks away) and I do believe that my last visit will be just that. I found the staff to be quite unfriendly and somewhat intimidating. I can't make that a blanket statement but the 3 people I interacted with made me feel like I wasn't worthy of staying there which I hadn't experienced before. As a long standing Marriott elite member I was quite put off by the treatment. Very unimpressed. The particular room I stayed in was clean and modern but incredibly small. Not a deal breaker but something to be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of traffic noise, not particularly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Delegator
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard to be close to a business meeting on Madison Ave. This was, unfortunately, one of the least appealing hotels I've stayed at in a while. It's not that there is something WRONG with the hotel room. It was large enough, the bed was OK, etc. But everything had a very cold and sterile feel, with nothing comfortable about it. Maybe it was the color of the compact fluorescents, or the high ceilings, but it felt like being in a hospital instead of a hotel. There were two really bad parts to this property, however. The internet service was terrible. I was getting latency in the 2-4 second range (yes, that is seconds, not milliseconds) which made computer use painful at best, impossible at worst. This was true for both the wired and wireless connections. The second problem was traffic noise. I'm no hick, and I've visited midtown Manhattan before. But, I was on the 15th floor, and I had to use earplugs to get to sleep. It was almost as if a window was open, or single-glazed (I checked, they are double-pane windows). Whatever the reason, this hotel had more traffic noise than I had experienced when staying in Times Square for New Years even a couple of years ago. All in all I wouldn't stay here again. There are too many other choices, and this was neither particularly cheap nor particularly nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: dg123
Reviews.Content: Overall happy with my recent stay. Staff was VERY nice and helpful. Rooms are small compared to other Courtyard Marriott locations. Bed was very comfy and bathroom very clean. Having a restaurant on site was nice because there is nothing nearby but its basically a diner. I would def recommend this hotel IF you can get a good discount; I paid rack rates and expected a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fishbone96
Reviews.Content: Apart from being blocks from the subway, this hotel is just fine. I got a great rate through the Marriott website and enjoyed a quiet and restful night. In terms of layout and amenities, it's a typical Courtyard hotel, which is just fine if all you need is a basic clean and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Courtyard - few glitches”
Reviews.Author: beachtherapy1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very typical of a Courtyard. Did have higher floors which made the room quiet, which was nice. However we booked a king bed and a AAA rate and got neither. The rate was corrected after but we had to stay with a queen. The staff was actually really helpful. You can easily get a nicer hotel for the cost if this location isn't necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Replace Staff”
Reviews.Author: LoveTraveler77
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard is a nice hotel overall. The location is not located right in the middle of the action but close enough to everything. My room was spacious for a king sized bed room in Mid-town Manhattan where most of the rooms are cubby holes and the bed was super comfy. The room; including the bathroom was clean and the shower was nice a spacious. The only bad thing when it came to housekeeping was I found another person’s gym membership ID, and two rooms keys from another hotel when I opened up the sofa bed. This tells me not much attention is given to cleaning under the couch cushions. Check in speed was excellent; I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but let me tell you why I wouldn’t probably stay here again. Upon check-in I decided to use the hotel’s valet service instead of parking my car myself so that I may come and go as I please without being charged every time I used my car. There was no one outside to greet me and take my car. The security guard on duty informed me that the bellman would be down in a minute to take my car. It took another 15 minutes for someone to assist me with my car, and when he arrived he took a personal phone call for the next five minutes. I was informed that I needed to contact the valet service when I wanted to take my car out 30 minutes prior to coming down. Upon check-out my wife called the desk 30 minutes prior to us leaving the room. When we got downstairs our car was not available. After 20 minutes of waiting I asked the bellman if he could check on my car. Another gentleman, who informed me that he was waiting for almost 30 minutes after he got downstairs, asked the bell to check on his car as well. I was informed that my car was coming shortly; it took another 50 minutes later. That’s right; I waited an hour for my car. Apparently the person in PBX that took my wife’s call didn’t inform the front desk, or the valet staff before he or she went on break. What really bothered me is the reaction of the staff during this time. Everyone from the valet staff that refused to answer my questions, to the two young ladies at the front desk who did nothing but ignore the guest in the lobby waiting for too patiently for their cars. Instead they took it upon themselves to take this time to make personal phone calls. As a former employee of Marriott, I don’t remember making personal calls at the desk being acceptable to be in our employee handbook. I do remember being told to feel empowered to assist the guest at anytime. In addition to ignoring the guest, the young ladies at the desk really didn’t seem to care about the situation. If this hotel is unable to adequately provide valet service to the guest of this hotel maybe they should consider ending the valet service and allow guest to park their cars for only five dollars more around the corner in the same parking lot the hotel uses.

Reviews.Title: “Not original but highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Fayerweather
Reviews.Content: As usual, I'm conflicted. Too many good reviews and the price will go up and the vacancy rate down--leaving us again in search of that oxymoron, namely a good deal in NYC! But this is as of now, at least, a first-rate establishment--friendly, clean, quiet, well-proportioned if smallish rooms, clean pool, and decent restaurant. And the price was more than reasonable on Priceline.com It's particularly good if you're driving into the city because the parking is reasonable ($20/per night) and it's located right off the FDR Drive at 92nd.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal on the upper East Side”
Reviews.Author: Markbo52
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel because it was close to my daughter's apartment. Was a little worried what we would get for $127/night. Arrived at 8:30 am on Friday and planned to just drop out bags, but they had a room available and let us check in! Room was a single king on the 12th floor. It was roomy for NYC, had been recently renovated, and had a wonderful skyline view out of the large window. The room was quiet on the first night but on the second night, we were disturb by voices in the adjoining room (the connecting door didn't muffle normal conversation very well). The lobby is large and nicely decorated; didn't try the restaurant/lounge. The fitness room and pool in the lower level are quite nice and very well equipped. It's a bit of a hike to the subway stops (86th and 96th at about 5th), but easy to catch buses and taxis. There are a number of nice restaurants nearby (especially on 2nd). Easy access to the East River Esplanade for running and walking. Felt safe walking in the area even late at night. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. They allow us to check out late on Sunday (1:00 p.m.) All in all, it was a very nice hotel and a great bargain for the price. The main drawback is its distance from the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: hoodie0022
Reviews.Content: Honestly, they did a great job. The door guys were great, the people at the front desk were great and the price was cheap. Not all that close to a subway station but it is within walking distance. All and all a great visit! And and the gym/pool were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, friendly staff and fab value for money”
Reviews.Author: MangoC68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff were very friendly both in reception and in the bar/92nd street cafe. They went out of there way to make recommendations of things to see and do, especially highlighting free attractions ! We ate breakfast every morning in the 92nd Street Cafe and found it to be extremely reasonable and a very good choice. Rooms were spacious - we had a room with 2 queens. Wi-fi was free in the rooms - it stated on the website that this was only in public areas so that was a real bonus for us. There are lots of bars (mainly sports/irish bars) in the area and a good selection of restaurants. It's around a 30-40 minute walk to 5th Ave shops but a very pleasant stroll through Central Park. There were lots of cabs outside the hotel and it was about a 10 min walk to the tube station. We will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: Kevin047
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel HUGE by NYC standards good beds clean nice and well taken care of ! all in all a very good hotel A word of Warning aboutr "black cars" vs taxis taxis are usually WAY cheaper and metered please please if you have any questions ask your bellman.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Week Ever! :)”
Reviews.Author: SS1991
Reviews.Content: We (mom, dad, Sister and me) went to new york for 8 days in February to celebrate my dads 50th birthday. We stopped at this hotel and was very impressed from the very start, we had just had a horrendous airport transfer and was very jet lagged. As soon as we arrived at the hotel the doorman couldnt do enough for us, he carried the bags up to the hotel room and came and checked on us to make sure we had settled in well (obviously expecting a tip). The hotel staff were very friendly and couldnt do enough for you weather you wanted tickets booking or just random info. We had a family room x2 double beds, a tv, bathroom and a cupboard (the room was28 stories high!). it was very clean and the maids did a fantastic job! The location is excellent as you are situated right by a subway station and you are next to a supermarket and only a 20 minute slow walk to Times square and 10 minutes from 5th avenue! No where in New york is cheap and the breakfasts in the hotel really were'nt ($18 for breakfast!), theres a McDonalds 1 block down so thats where we ate every day. We were typical tourists and the people are very friendly in shops or just people that live there for some reason they kept on asking us how we felt about whats gong on in the world e.g. Barak Obama, the war, the financial crisis. I guess they just wanted to see how we felt. The atmosphere is awsome in and out of the hotel and would recommend this hotel to anyone, it wasnt cheap but what do you expect for staying in New York City! One last thing dont expcet it to be cheap the restaraunts are so expensive, even little cafe's and leave a tip!, we went into this one cafe near the world trade centre site and the waitress came up to us adn told us we hadnt tipped enough!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Clean”
Reviews.Author: dobie2
Reviews.Content: This was an impromptu weekend getaway to NYC that we booked the night before on Priceline (name your own price). Given the price we paid, and that it was only rated a 3 star hotel, it was a nice surprise. We asked for a king sized bedroom, which we were given, and it was around the corner from the gym which looked pretty good (but we didn't use it). Carpet, furniture, dresser, bathroom - everything was very clean. A/C worked well. No musty smell that you sometimes get. You can definitely hear the subway running underneath, but it wasn't loud enough to be a bother or rouse us from sleep (and I'm a light sleeper). People who checked us in/out were gracious to us even though we were about 10-15 minutes late in checking out. Right next to the subway station. Room was spacious, with a view toward the street below - nice at night with all the lights. Great place to stay - wouldn't mind staying here again for the same price (~$150/night).

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Hotel, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: dubtee15
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this summer since it had a preferred rate with a local hospital. The location is decent, although it is a bit far from the subway (10-15 minute walk). The room was clean and comfortable - actually pretty large for an NYC hotel. Our room had a weird, handicap-accessible bathroom which I assume was due to us getting the hospital rate. Staff was friendly and helpful. Quick tip, go for the $20/night parking at the end of the block rather than the $40/night valet parking. We almost made that mistake. Overall, I'd stay here again if in NYC on business but probably not for personal travel since I'd wanted to be closer to sites and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location to move about the city”
Reviews.Author: Caraib321
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded in advance by David of the front desk to a suite. I’m thinking we’ll invite people we know who live in NY over for drinks! No way. Although very nice, the suite did not have a separate living room. It was designed more like a studio apartment with everything in the same room separated by a sort of half wall divider. The room had two large corner windows with a nice view of the East River. The room included a small sofa, modern desk with chair and nice closet. This property had flat screen in the lobby, but not in the room. This hotel is on the Upper East Side at 92 and First Avenue close to good restaurants and public transportation including the Lexington Avenue subway at 86th. Although the photo gives the impression of a tall building, it is not a skyscraper. It is located near several high-rise apartments. This property is great if you need to travel by public transportation. We jumped on the subway to get to the US Open. We also hopped on the express train and rode just two stops to Times Square. We took a taxi one night from a jazz club for about $15 because we didn’t feel like dealing with the subway. If you want something to eat, you’ll find many nice inexpensive good restaurants in the area on Second Avenue going southbound. You get good food by eating where the people who live in the area eat. However, do like the locals try to do, go to breakfast before 11 am. After that time they serve the same food, but raise the prices and don’t give away free orange juice. Skip the restaurant coffee and go to the nearby Starbucks for espresso. The hotel included a restaurant and bar on the first floor. It looked sort of dark and sat off to the back area of the lobby. It didn’t look interesting at all in terms of going there to eat. The lower level included a gym with a wonderful 50- foot swimming pool at 81 degree water temperature. If you’re a swimmer, you’ll love this pool!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bmorechick
Reviews.Content: I volunteer for a non-profit cervical cancer organization and we were recently in NY to hold our 2nd annual awareness walk. We stayed at a different Marriott last year but decided to try the Courtyard Marriott. I was not in charge of accommodations so I had no idea what to expect. The valet/bellhop was helpful and prompt. Check in was swift even though we had 10+ rooms to confirm. Like someone else mentioned, the elevators are rather slow so be prepared to wait if you are attempting to use during peak traffic times. We had to print some registration forms out for the walk the next day so I took my credit card with me into the business center. I was pleasantly surprised that not only was the use of the computer free, but I could print there for free as well! The hotel even offered free wireless in the rooms. I won't even tell you how much this cost us last year at the other hotel!!! The front desk was extremely helpful. There were certain odds and end items that we forgot and they were happy to let us use them. I did not use the pool nor the gym but they looked very clean and welcoming. I especially liked the view of the pool from the hotel lobby. One thing I wish they would update is that the only ice machine is on the lower level. The hotel is in a residential location so it is quiet (despite the typical horn honking) and safe. I didn't venture out on foot too much so I am unable to speak about any restaurants near the hotel. I ate appetizers at the hotel bar/lounge and had dinner in other locations (Melba's Restaurant was ok and Patsy's Pizza was ok). When we have our next board meeting, I will definitely recommend staying at this location again next year. We got a great rate and the amenities were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: torontotraveller1066
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights during the last heat wave. Thankfully the air conditioning worked great. The rooms are a bit small but extremely clean and the price was very reasonable for a New York 3 star hotel. Very close to Central Park and Museum Mile. We have visited New York in the past but never had time to visit any of the museums or Central Park. If this type of trip interests you then this is a great location. We went to the Guggenheim, Museum of Modern Art and the Museum of Natural History as well as a couple of visits to Central Park. To get anywhere downtown, take any bus across town to Lexington Avenue (about a 20 minute walk). Hop on the Lexington subway at either 86th or 96th and it will take you to the bottom of Manhatten and all places in between. Central Park West is where the great hotels overlooking the park are located including The Dakota. There are numerous deli's close to the hotel including several fine restaurants. If you like Italian then try out Pinnocios - just around the corner on first avenue two blocks south of the hotel. The food was amazing. The only problem we had with the hotel was the elevators - only two and sometimes slow. We stayed on the 15th floor and would recommend you stay at a lower floor if available. The pool and exercise room are fantastic and great for the kids. I would definately recommend this hotel. We got our great deal on Priceline.com. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “One night stop”
Reviews.Author: sweetknees
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel. The rooms were roomy, clean and quiet. A very clean Hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. A little far out of the centre of the city for sight seeing but taxis and bus serices were cheap and good. You could also walk if you wanted too. It felt safe to stay there and walk around day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Price is Right! Staff is Wrong!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cook7166
Reviews.Content: For the price, the hotel is perfect, but the staff doesn't care or doesn't help. When we asked for the number for grand central station, they gave us directions to their business center so that we could google it. This is awful customer service, and I think with the beautiful location and great property that with an aligned staff they might actually be a great hotel. Unfortunately, not the case.

Reviews.Title: “We made the BEST CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: TOESDrama
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard has been the best choice for us!!! After extensive reading of reviews at TripAdvisor and other sites...I felt we could not go wrong w/ this location. And we were right!!! It is convenient to get around Manhattan....on a pleasant street that is not too crowded or noisy. Right next door is a pharmacy/convenience store for drinks, snacks, etc!!!! And beyond that as well as across the street is a subway entrance......so very easy to get to Times Square, the theatres, Central Park, etc...... I did my homework.....and it paid off!!! Booking our flight + this hotel really saved money!!! (I used Travelocity) The front desk staff is friendly...asking how our day was when we return each time. Our needs have all been met......and we have the room to spread out! We have three adults....my husband and I plus an 18 year old teen. The king room w/ a sofa bed was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Not the kind of hotel I would book for my own vacation”
Reviews.Author: dmdb
Reviews.Content: I would call this a plain vanilla hotel. It had a variety of customers--business people, families. The lobby was usually busy if not chaotic. Only 2 elevators and you had to use your room key for security purposes to get to your floor. The room was quiet and clean. It was a chain so nothing unique about it but functional and was fine for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a couple of nights but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: OnTheWayHome
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a clean, friendly hotel with excellent service. Reception were always happy to answer any of our questions and did so thoroughly. They were also very helpful to the point that when we went to get the key for the mini bar from reception, they advised us that the mini bar was expensive and that we would be better off going across the road to get some beers, and that they would provide us with a small fridge for our room which they did by the time we got back. The rooms were quite small with hardly any room to move around, however we did have two queen size beds. The hotel is within walking distance of Central Park and the underground lines, although it does take half an hour to an hour to get into town. All in all it was a pleasant stay but I am sure there are a number of hotels in the same category around New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great stay all together”
Reviews.Author: newtonewyouk
Reviews.Content: My mother and daughter (11y.o) and I went on a "girl trip" to NYC. This hotel was in a perfect place with neighborhood surrounding it and MD offices. Also, it is VERY safe to walk out at night here to go to a local resturant for dinner. It is about 4 blocks up to Central Park and not that far from the Metropolitan. Good place on 2nd & 92nd to get pizza (Delizia) The staff was excellent and attentive. They assisted us with forgotten items and a hotel car back to LGA. The hotel resturant offers a great breakfast at a reasonable price and it is huge so you can split an omlet if you want. I can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for seeing the museums”
Reviews.Author: Atomique
Reviews.Content: Courtyard upper east side made my stay in my favorite city all that more enjoyable. For once I was not traveling for business and I picked this location purely because of it's proximity to museum mile. The courtyard is nestled on the northern end of the upper east side by east Harlem. It is a short distance from Central Park and from museum mile. It is also a reasonable cab fare from the airports; in my case LGA. The lobby was nice, nothing special. The staff was friendly. The rooms are small by North American standards, regular sized for NYC. Everything was very clean. The bathroom was good sized and had minimal toiletries. The bed was very comfortable. The view was fair. There is a weighted mini bar with snacks and drinks. No refrigerator or microwave. The desk included a free wired internet hook up with a cord that doesn't reach beyond the desk. The safe in the closet isn't big enough for regular sized laptops. In New York it's all about location and for me it was perfect and the price was fair for a major chain. If you are going to the common tourist attractions that are in lower Manhattan this hotel is quite a bit north for those activities. It was an average hotel for an average price so I gave it an average rating.

Reviews.Title: “Would have rated higher, but...”
Reviews.Author: torero94
Reviews.Content: ...they didn't respond to my concerns about safety. On the last day (of 4), my door stuck, and we were trapped in the room. We called down to the front desk, and they sent a security guard up. I was able to get the door open as he arrived, and he looked at and talked to me like I was idiot for not knowing how to use a lock, and said he'd have maintenance look at it. When we came back a few hours later to check out, the same thing happened. This time, we had to get the housekeepers to let us out through the adjoining room, and they mentioned that they knew that that room did that from time to time. When I talked to a manager about it, saying it was a major fire hazard, he apologized profusely, and said he'd look into it. After I got home, I wrote a review on another site, and only then got an e-mail from another manager at the hotel, who offered me another apology and said he'd refund a night's stay. Surprise, surprise... almost 1 year later, I still haven't seen that refund.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: DoubleG828
Reviews.Content: I surprised my daughter for her 18th Birthday with a weekend in NYC. We went to see the Broadway Show, Jersey Boys - which I recommend everyone to see - Phenomenal Show!
